intro: Exallage paradoxa, commonly known as the paradoxical alpine bellflower, is a rare and striking plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It is characterized by its distinctive bell-shaped flowers, which are typically blue or purple in color. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and thrives in cold, rocky environments. It is known for its unique growth pattern, often forming dense clusters on steep slopes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
